versos: (watchmen) Isaiah 62:6 - "I have posted watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem; they will never be silent day or night. You who call on the Lord, give yourselves no rest,";;;
(tasted) Hebrews 6:4 - "For it is impossible, in the case of those who have once been enlightened, who have tasted the heavenly gift, and have shared in the Holy Spirit,";;;
(disperse) Acts 5:37 - "After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and led a band of people in revolt. He too was killed, and all his followers were scattered.";;;
(saveth) Psalm 34:18 - The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.;;
(jehovah) Isaiah 26:4 - Trust in the Lord forever
(shua) Psalm 60:4 - "But for those who fear you, you have raised a banner to be unfurled against the bow.";;;
(michal) 2 Samuel 6:23 - And michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.;;;
(ahimaaz) 2 Samuel 18:27 - "The watchman said, 'It seems to me that the first one runs like ahimaaz son of Zadok.'";;;
(abner) 2 Samuel 3:33 - "The king sang this lament for abner.";;;
(ner) Proverbs 20:27 - "The human spirit is the lamp of the Lord that sheds light on ones inmost being.";;;
(valiant) Psalm 60:12 - "With God we will gain the victory, and he will trample down our enemies.";;;
(helmet) 1 Thessalonians 5:8 - But let us who are of the day be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and as a helmet, the hope of salvation.;;;
(trench) 2 Chronicles 14:9 - "Now Zerah the Cushite came against them with an army of a million men and three hundred chariots, and they came to Mareshah.";;;
(scrip) Luke 9:3 - "And he said unto them, Take nothing for your journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.";;;
(sunk) Job 8:11 - "Can papyrus grow tall where there is no marsh Can reeds thrive without water";;;
(sheath) Genesis 3:21 - "The Lord God made garments of skin for Adam and his wife and clothed them.";;;
(behaved) Psalm 101:2 - "I will be careful to lead a blameless life-- when will you come to me I will conduct the affairs of my house with a blameless heart.";;;
